Reviews.Title: “Service rivals some 5-star hotels”
Reviews.Author: Royal B
Reviews.Content: Having traveled quite a bit, and having had the privilege of visiting hotels both decadent and economical, I could compare the warm service here against that of some hotels many times the cost. I don't make that statement lightly. The genuine warmth here surpassed the treatment in the Royal Suite of a prominent cruise line, and the high roller suite at one of the most luxuriant hotels in Vegas. I kid you not. Our flight arrived late at night, but Theo was there in minites with the shuttle to pick us up. His conversation was friendly and upbeat without being intrusive. In short, he made us smile after a long and tiring flight. When we pulled up to the hotel, Dan was waiting outside to greet the shuttle and see us inside. While checking in, he got us some ice cold bottles of water, while Theo was offering everything he could think of to make our stay more comfortable. We felt like royalty! With snack bags that they gave us in hand, we headed to our room, where we found two more bottles of water and a Twix bar set out for us. The next morning Trish at the front desk had the same friendly and helpful attitude, so I know this must be fostered by the management among all employees. Kudos to GM Gary Bowers for encouraging staff to go above and beyond. This hotel gets that it only takes small investments of amenities, provided with a genuine friendly smile, to completely turn a guest's day around and create lifelong fans. As for the room, it was spotlessly clean, completely noise-free, and with more bath amenities than other Hamptons. The only thing it lacked was a microwave, but I'm willing to bet they would have brought one from home if necessary to make us happy. =)

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: follyfx
Reviews.Content: In Tempe for Spring Training (our first time) and picked this hotel for its nearness to Diablo Stadium - we could have walked there. What a find in a hotel! The room was clean and the bathroom spotless. Lots of nice little perks, shelves in the bath and lap desk, both in the room and in the lobby. The bed smelled good and was soft and lots of pillows. Breakfast fabulous for continental fair, so much more than I expected. There were some VERY loud kids in the pool outside our window Saturday morning which was irritating and impossible to sleep in with but not the hotel's fault, just crappy parents. So much good quality and comfy feeling for a reasonable hotel price! We will be staying here for our trips in the future, and there will be many. I will be looking up the Hampton Inn hotel line anywhere we go if this is the quality/price we can expect.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: R F
Reviews.Content: The price was inexpensive but the neighbourhood leaves a LOT to be desired. I would look for another location in a nicer part of town. Very close to airport but yet didn't hear the airplanes. I did hear the neighbours across the parking lot screaming at each other though! A sketchy neighbourhood! The a/c unit had 1 speed (HIGH) so we had to shut it off due to too noisy. The rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for the early birds”
Reviews.Author: jblano
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights. the evening crew was excellent (can't say that much for the 11pm-7am crew).. Colleen, Bree & Matt were top notch and made my stay very pleasant. They were very helpful with anything I needed. They were very friendly and offered up suggestions on places to eat and play... The reason for my negative remark on the late night crew is this. I walked down to the lobby one time (11:15pm) and heard the blonde at the front counter acting like a 16 year old child (very unprofessional). Way too much gossip for me. She was complaining about previous shifts not getting things done to "her" satisfaction... I must admit, the hotel was wonderful. I think she was on a power trip. Maybe she has issues I'm unaware of. As with typical Hamptons, the breakfast was satisfactory and the rooms were clean. Since I was traveling on business, I appreciate a friendly face and expected things being taken care of. They definately took care of the basics and beyond. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “StGreat beds, great staff”
Reviews.Author: philipb445
Reviews.Content: What a find. If you are in need of a great inexpensive hotel near the airport this is the place. The staff is awesome. They had a bag breakfast waiting for us when we had a 6am flight. Could not have been nicer. Great 24 hour shuttle service as well. Close to the airport with spacious CLEAN rooms and very comfortable beds. Reasonably priced and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, and quiet”
Reviews.Author: smokymtndeb
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn and Suites is very convenient for the Phoenix Airport. Easy on and off from the freeway. I was promptly greeted as I walked through the front doors to check in. Check in was quick and efficient and I was on my way to my room. My room was clean and quiet. I found the room to be comfortable and spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable, too. Breakfast was your typical Hampton Inn breakfast, a variety of hot and cold items. The breakfast area was clean and well stocked. If I'm in the area again, I'll definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Hotel...Some Issues...”
Reviews.Author: tucsoncop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on Christmas Eve as we booked the park and stay rate so we could park at the Inn and not worry about the stress of finding parking at the crowded Sky Harbor Airport on Christmas Day. The cleanliness of the hotel and attentiveness of the staff was great! Unfortunately, the breakfast was below standards usually seen at the Hampton Inn. The eggs were very dry, the sausage patties were cold and there was absolutely no coffee... NO COFFEE?? That's right, coffee was not available until after I had already finished my meal. I would have thought someone would have had extra coffee going. We ate at 8AM and there was 1 other person eating breakfast so it wasn't like it was crowded. The prior evening, the desk clerk reserved the 10AM shuttle to the airport. This would have given us ample time to catch our 12:00PM flight without any stress. Much to my surprise, as it was Christmas day, the shuttle driver was not working and the Inn used an outside company for shuttle service. My wife and I went downstairs at 9:40AM. The clerk immediately asked for my family name. I told him the name and he confirmed we were on the 10AM shuttle for the airport. At 10AM, the contract shuttle had not yet arrived. The clerk called the vendor / contract shuttle who advised they were on the way. By 10:15AM, the shuttle had still failed to arrive. I inquired with the desk clerk about the shuttle and he again called the contract company who said the driver would arrive momentarily. By 10:30AM the shuttle driver finally arrived. He did not handle our bags and walked inside to use the restroom! We were in a hurry, he was 30 minutes late and now he was taking a restroom break??? Unacceptable!!! We finally got into the shuttle van and arrived at the airport at 10:40AM. My flight was to depart at noon and was boarding at 11:30AM. My wife was extremely stressed out and after checking in and going through security, It was 11:15. While we still had enough time to catch our flight, the stress we hoped to avoid by staying at the Hampton Inn was ever present. It was not a good beginning to the holiday vacation. One of my biggest complaints was that there was a maintenance man speaking to us at the hotel while the front desk clerk called the shuttle company. Why one of them couldn't take the shuttle van parked just outside of the door, is beyond me. I felt that there should have been a backup plan, should the contract company not arrive. We didn't miss our flight, but I was sadly disappointed by the service provided by this Hampton Inn. I must commend the staff, as they were friendly and helpful, they just seemed unsure of what to do when the shuttle didn't arrive. I almost left and parked myself (which would have been counter productive, as the entire reason I booked the hotel was for the parking.) The inn was extremely clean and I was impressed by the wonderful rooms. I just wish the breakfast staff would have ensured the food was prepared better and that the shuttle situation would have been resolved to my satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: ind_sub
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to unwind for two nights and this was our choice. It was the right one for us and with the outstanding room, great internet connectivity, and fabulous breakfast we were very pleased that we chose this hotel. The staff was unbelievably nice and checked us in early without any comments. The desk help was outstanding and helped us with directions by showing us on the computer and even offering to print a map. Breakfast was the best and when they said a hot breakfast they meant it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomswife
Reviews.Content: Needed to stay in this area, as it is close to family. Several other hotels (resorts) in this area were $200-$300 a night. We got a suite room for in the $80 range. A regular room was in the $50 range. The suite is definately worth the price as the room is huge with a couch, several chairs, desk, bar area, etc. The bathroom was plenty big too. Everything was clean. If you reserve online, make sure you request a pool side view. The other side of the building is just parking lot, and not much to look at. The front desk person said they went through a major rennovation this year and are going to do the outside next year (2012). The staff were all very friendly. The breakfast in the morning was good. Nothing super fancy or crazy, but they had eggs, sausage, home fries, warm oatmeal, make your own waffles, etc. The pool area and jacuzzi were good. They even had towels out there. The airport shuttle was wonderful and very timely. Occassionally we could hear a plane way off in the distance, but overall it was very quiet. Not sure if we just didn't have anyone around us, but it was incredibly quiet. I am sure that someone who is extremely picky would find things wrong with this place. It is kind of set on a corner by a gas station right off the freeway. So, it's not in a 'fluffy' location, but it is nice, it's clean and we never once felt unsafe. Considering what people had to pay close to this location, I'll take this hotel any day.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BrownDawg
Reviews.Content: A pretty typical Hampton. Comfortable bed usual amenities. Staff was great and the shuttle driver would take guests to nearby restaurants and pick them up as long as it didn't interfere with airport pickups. Got a lift to Aunt Chiladas, which was a mistake. Cute name but the Mexican food was tailored for Gringo tastes. Only minor glitch was a slow running bathroom sink. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for my one night stay...overall, a good hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: bluefaery
Reviews.Content: You basically turn right into the the hotel parking lot when you exit the 10 freeway, making it convenient but not super pretty as far as the neighborhood is concerned. The hotel was clean as well as the room. The staff was friendly. My only request that I have when I book a room online is to not have an adjoining room. I was initially given an adjoining room and went back downstairs to the check-in desk to have this fixed. The employee was apologetic and remedied the situation immediately. My room was spacious and comfortable. The decor was a little old but fine. The breakfast was fine-typical hotel already cooked sitting in the warmers type of breakfast. I don't know that I'll stay here again since typically when I'm in Phoenix I like to stay in Central Phoenix or west Phoenix. This was a little east of me. I also didn't feel terribly safe walking next door at night to the circle K/Del Taco for a bite to eat. For one night it was decent. Overall, it's an okay hotel for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location to interstate and airport”
Reviews.Author: Sc00terT
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this location during a recent business trip and was very pleased. I like Hampton Inn for the consistent quality, and this location was no exception. Staff was friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and nice, and it is conveniently located off I-10 not far from the airport. This location is also one of the Hampton's that still does the "Manager's Reception" in the evenings, and had some nice goodies. I'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Reliable Place”
Reviews.Author: jantravlz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after a trip we took recently. Because my husband is newly handicapped, we requested an accessible room. The room had a very nice roll-in shower and was clean and convenient, though it was quite small. We especially appreciated the 24-hour airport shuttle here, the take-away breakfast (we had to leave the hotel before 6 a.m.), and the free parking for our car, which we left here during our trip. Upon our return, we were able to enjoy the hot breakfast, which was perfectly fine for us. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but a moderate hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stoks
Reviews.Content: The location is convenient near I 10 and the rooms are OK. breakfast is like other Hampton Inns, i.e. poor to moderate. I haven't experienced "dry" Hampton Inns before, but this one is. Fortunately there's a convenience store around the corner so a cold beer can still be obtained - why is this "dry" nonsense? Staff was very helpful and I do acknowledge great service: I left my laptop power supply inmy room and they mailed it to my home address right away following my phone call from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Will Exceed your Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria1619
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at this particular Hampton. The first visit was in April i was given a suite and the large bed, flat screen tv, a living space and a bar area and Oh lets not forget the nice size restroom i was as HAPPY as can be. They serve a breakfast and it was very nice alot of options, but i went for the egg and bacon and sausage tasted great. Free newspaper, Free WIFI. My second visit i was given a standard room by my employer, though i wish it had a refirg. being my extended stay this time i really cant complain the bed is comfy i still get the free wifi, breakfast and this time i even tried the happy hour snacks they serve was not bad. They even have little breakfast bags i was able to grab as i rushed out for a meeting. It came with a muffin a snack bar some water and an apple. it helped tye me over till i was able to grab lunch!! I will let my friends know of this little Gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the way to airport.....”
Reviews.Author: gojennygoRomegeorgia
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to stay the night before our plane left to return home. this served our needs very well, right off interstate, close to airport, very clean and a great breakfast that was included in price.... They also have shuttle to airport if needed. We told them as we checked in we were heading to airport next day and they offered to take us to airport that night to drop off our car and then they would take us to airport next morning. I thought this was very nice of them, we didnt take them up on it because our plane didnt leave till 1:oo but they didnt have to do that. Would stay again if in area....

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Staff was TOP Notch”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveler030
Reviews.Content: The Hampton room was very spacious (studio) with comfy beds, chairs, kitchenette, etc. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate our needs. For instance, we returned our rental car the night before and they picked us up at the airport and brought us back to the hotel -NO QUESTIONS asked. And with a smile to boot. They were more than happy to map out the mall and route to the Hard Rock Cafe (which was also top notch food and service for a hard Rock-and we have visited our share of Hard Rocks-NYC, Tokyo, Cancun....). We mentioned to the Hampton staff that we had a very early morning flight and would miss the breakfast. They said--No worries, we'll pack a breakfast to go! Better yet, they said they'll set up early and we can help ourselves. We had great coffee, yogurt, fresh fruit, toast, etc. The night before, they had fresh large soft pretzels, nachos and cheese, tacos, etc. It looked good, but we passed because we just had dinner. But it was a nice gesture for those just checking in from a flight or long drive. I would definitely stay there again and would recommend them to everyone! No REGRETS!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice if you are Running the Phoenix Marathon”
Reviews.Author: Runnermom3
Reviews.Content: Primary purpose of the trip was for the Arizona Rock N Roll Marathon. Very pleased with how the hotel catered to the runners. Very helpful with transportation to and from the race and airport. Was pleasantly surprised that the hotel had pre-purchased light rail passes for the runners. That was above and beyond customer service. Enabled the runners to focus on the race instead of waiting to purchase necessary rail passes. Thanks, Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Work”
Reviews.Author: ItchyFeetBTS
Reviews.Content: I was here for one night on business and wish I'd stayed at a different Hampton. The staff wasn't particularly friendly. When I checked in the front desk clerk was rather disheveled and finished what sounded to be a personal phone call before checking me in. The morning staff was better. Breakfast was OK, but food kept running out and it took a while for it to be replaced. The furniture was rather battered and banged up and the A/C was extremely loud. The desk was positioned so that the A/C blew right at you, so it wasn't very comfortable. This property was OK, but there are many better Hamptons in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: SpaceCityGirl
Reviews.Content: We had a nice one night stay at the Hampton Inn Airport South in Phoenix before flying home. The room was a nice size, and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom was nicely furnished and had lots of little bottles of shampoo, conditioner, etc... I used the fitness room shortly after arriving. It was pretty small, but had a treadmill and two bikes. The treadmill was fine, and I had the room all to myself, which was nice. The breakfast was good, but not spectacular. I just had fruit and ceral. Nothing special. The business center was well equipped with 3 computers and printers, to print out your boarding pass. Its located near the airport, but is also close to to Arizona State University. I thought the value for the price was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING Value”
Reviews.Author: SouthernTraveler1861
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two nights of our 16-day Western vacation at this hotel and I wish we could have spent the ENTIRE vacation there! It was a great hotel at a good price. It was everything you would expect of a Hampton Inn: great breakfast, clean and comfortable rooms, good parking, friendly employees, everything... There is no nearby restaurant, but they operate a free shuttle service to restaurants and shopping centers upon request. I wish we could have moved this motel to every place we visited during our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower52
Reviews.Content: A typical airport hotel. Outdated and expensive. Slow internet, bad service (wake-up call came 10 minutes late). I strongly recommend Hyatt Place with more space, modern design, and top friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to scratch”
Reviews.Author: happytravelpal
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. I agree with the previous reviewer who commented on a strong moldy smell in the rooms. This hit me like a truck upon entering the room. The room was very small & dimly lit. The bed however was the standard Hampton bed & was very comfortable. The bathroom had a urine smell, I have never come across anything like it at a Hampton hotel. If I wasn't so tired when I arrived I would have run. With so many hotels in Phoenix I would certainly not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a difference a year makes”
Reviews.Author: traveLAn
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this Hampton Inn again because of the great experience I had last year. Unfortunately, those fond memories quickly faded as the reality of its current state left me with a less than favorable experience. The room was still decent, but it did not have the same "clean" feel as before or like other Hampton Inn's I've stayed at, for that matter. The hot breakfast was not as tasty, either, probably downgraded due to the economic slump. Moreover, I had a very dramatic end to my stay there as the elevator malfunctioned on my way down and dropped a few inches upon reaching the first floor. I heard some metal pieces fall off as this occurred. I rang the emergency bell a number of times, but no help came. Fortunately, the doors eventually opened, and I was able to exit the elevator. This event seemed indicative of my stay at there, and compelled me to express my disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Pick a different hotel”
Reviews.Author: jezzie61
Reviews.Content: When we opened the door to our rooms, the smell hit us. Smelled like mold and mildew. Front desk did ask if they could spray the room. If I hadn't prepaid, I would have left right away (no refunds given if you prepay as the rate is cheaper). Toilet ran forever after flushing, the on/off buttons on the TV's in both rooms were broken, and the hot tub timer was also broken and would only stay on for five minutes no matter what time you set it to. I will never stay here again and will pick a different Hampton Inn on my next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: jojobibs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hampton Inn one night but wished we could stay longer..Honestly,it was a wonderful experience.Bed was really comfortable with down pillows and bedding.Our room was really clean with all the comforts of home.When we entered the lobby,it smelled like fresh baked cookies.They had a little store with snacks and items you may need while traveling.They had coffee available 24 hour with flavored creamers.The complimentary breakfast consisted of biscuits,bagels,danish,sausage,eggs,muffins,They also had a computrt in the lobby for early check-inn for flights.The best thing about this place is we payed $ 89/night for a place that way exceeded our expectations.Stay here while in pheonix,you will not be sorry!!

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: stevenwsmithii
Reviews.Content: There is nothing near this hotel and the restaurant/pub next door is a dive! This hotel seamed like they remodeled a run down old hotel. The breakfast was WEAK! i did enjoy the complimentary shuttle service to Mill Ave. and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, check smoking/nonsmoking”
Reviews.Author: AntonX2
Reviews.Content: This was a standard Hampton Inn, and all the normal amenities are provided. There were no surprises except one -- I booked a non-smoking room and although it was labeled as such on the door, it was obvious it had recently been a smoking room (it smelled like such). The location is in excellent reach of the airport, and parking is available and free. I had no problems getting anything I needed and the buffet breakfast was not bad. I would recommend it in a pinch, but would make sure you change your room if you don't like it immediately.

Reviews.Title: “perfect if need a room near the airport”
Reviews.Author: retired-teacher60
Reviews.Content: We were on the way home and needed a place to spend the night before our flight the next day. We checked in at the hotel, then dropped our rental car off. We had to take the shuttle bus to the airport and then call the hotel, but they came right out. The room was very nice - clean comfortable and roomy. There was a fitness room, but we were too tired. It was too hot (104!) to sit by the pool. There was an English pub next door which provided a decent supper. The hotel breakfast was above average, with a nice selection including poached eggs and bakery style pastries. The hotel took us to the airport the next day. All in all, we had a very nice stay. I certainly wouldn't stay in this area unless I had a plane to catch, but if you do, this was a very nice, convenient place to stay. Under the same circumstances, I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Arilisanne
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn & Suites is always a cut above other hotels at this price range. We were just looking for a cheap place to stay while we visited my brother, and were pleasantly surprised with the clean, spacious, quality accommodations. Breakfast was nothing special, but I can't complain about food that is free. Fitness center wasn't much more than a couple pieces of equipment but again, it didn't cost extra. This place is a great value, the rooms are clean, comfortable, and nicer than you'll expect them to be. I recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: TRVLassist
Reviews.Content: Reasonable hotel, located about 15 minutes drive from the airport. Also has free shuttle service altho’ did not have a chance to try this option. (Did see van by hotel entrance and looked nice.) Plenty of parking. Neighborhood is just fine. 5 minutes drive from ASU. Hotel is next to highway exit. In fact, if coming from the airport, it’s easiest to take the Hohokam Expy (#143) to its final exit, or come east on Broadway Rd, as the hotel’s cross-street (48th St) does not go all the way thru’ going south. Hotel staff very efficient. Fastest check-in I think I’ve ever experienced, and also got the type of room I had requested online. Breakfast area quite nice as was small exercise room. Free internet available. Pool area nicer than average for a mid-range chain altho’ not super large. (Sun gone by 3 pm.) Good maintenance overall. Room was acceptable size and very nice. Bathroom had three-tiered counter which was very useful for arranging toiletries. Only complaint was closet size. Clothes to be hung in armoire in about 2 feet of space, including where the iron and ironing board are located. OK if you’re there on business for one night. Not so good if you’re two people there for several days.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: lesleyjo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Hampton Inn Airport South for 2 nights at the end of November. My husband was there for business at Sky Harbour International, so the location of the hotel for us quite convenient. Overall our stay was quite nice - we had a clean, nicely decorated king room on the top floor. The beds were extremely comfy, with nice new linens and a cozy white duvet. Breakfast in the lobby was not too bad - the coffee was good, and they supply take out cups if you want to take it with you. There is alot of choice for the guest - yogurts, fruit, cereal, french toast, cereal, etc., so overall, an adequate breakfast. The pool area was small but very clean, and plenty of fresh towels to use right there. We didn't use the pool, but made use of the hottub in the evening. Very nice. The only real negative was that the location of the hotel is not great. There is not around the hotel, it seems almost on the edge of a residential area. The hotel is an easy drive to the University of Arizona (less than 10 minutes), so we found plenty of restaurants and pubs around the U of A. !

Reviews.Title: “Great airport transportation”
Reviews.Author: goodrzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn and took advantage of their airport shuttle. We checked in at the hotel, took our rental car back to the airport, and then called the Hotel to come and pick us up. If you are unfamiliar with the Phoenix Airport and their transportation to rental cars, take our word for it. It's cumbersome and crowded. The shuttle from the Hampton runs 24 hours a day and takes about ten minutes to get to or from the airport. The hotel is clean and the staff is very friendly. There is an English pub attached to the hotel which has an extensive beer list and a decent menu. If you're more in the mood for quick food, there's a DelTaco nearby. The beds are extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: shelllady
Reviews.Content: This place had the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Neat And Comfortabley Homey”
Reviews.Author: bwod010253
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inns are the no-frills version of Holiday Inn. You get a nice room that is conveniently located, free parking, newspaper, coffee, continental breakfast, etc. They even put out fresh-baked cookies at the registration counter. There's also a nice outdoor pool to relax at, after your busy day. What more do you need? My wife and I love them. This particular property is only 5 mins. drive from Sky Harbor (PHX) International Airport. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation”
Reviews.Author: localyocal2
Reviews.Content: Always pleased with a Hampton Inn. This hotel was clean, quiet, close to the airport. The beds were comfortable, the staff friendly, the breakfast consistent with the chain. No unpleasant surprises here. It seemed to have quite a few business travellers so it must be popular with them too. The only negative was it was hard to access and a little hard to find the sign which was obstructed by a tree. Unless you come to it in just the right direction you may not be able to cross a median in the road to enter the parking lot. We had used mapquest to find it , and the route they told us to take made no sense at all until we arrived there. We had to go around the area in a way that allowed us to make a right hand turn into the parking lot because of a median dividing the busy road. How on earth do those people at mapquest know all this stuff?

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations, great breakfast, okay area”
Reviews.Author: skat94
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in January 2006 for the Fiesta Bowl. This Hampton Inn was very reasonably priced compared to other hotels in the area. The hotel itself was in very nice condition. The rooms were modern and very comfortable. I don't expect much with a complimentary breakfast but this breakfast was good. The selection changed every day but it always included bagels/muffins/danishes as well as eggs/bacon/ham/pancakes etc.. There's also free parking and complimentary coffee all day in the lobby. There isn't much to do within walking distance. It's about a 5-10 minute drive to Arizona State's off-campus area for restaurants and shopping. Overall, I thought this property was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “NIce property and value”
Reviews.Author: mikedent
Reviews.Content: Stayed here start of Dec. for 2 nights. Easy freeway access. Not many restaurants in area except for Del Taco and the British Pub (good happy hour, expensive food). Very nice staff and shuttle service. Good breakfast with hot entrees and tasty coffee. Clean good sized rooms, nice bathroom. Slightly noisy through windows. Small useful fitness room and computers to use, also high-speed internet. Felt safe but area could be better. Pool looks inviting. Not in a tourist zone.

Reviews.Title: “O.K., watch out for pandhandlers”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Hampton Inns for business and I would rate this property as "O.K." The airport location is quite good and the British Pub next door is quite a trip. However, we had all sorts of problems checking in because we had two rooms with two separate reservations with the same last name and that seemed to throw off the desk clerk. This immediately followed being approached by a person in the parking lot begging for money--not all that comfortable when you are wheeling luggage and expensive computer equipment. We were told by the front desk clerk that they had been having problems with people accosting guests in the parking lot asking for money and they were working on upgrading their security measures. Until they can confidently control this, I would not recommend this property for a woman travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. I was not sure what to expect, but the rooms were great. The beds were very nice and the location of the hotel was perfect. Right off the freeway, close to arizona mills mall and mills avenue. The staff was very friendly. The only thing I did not like was the elevators, they seemed to make lots of strange noises, but they worked just fine. I will stay here again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: AlistairCoy
Reviews.Content: This is a really excellent place to stay close to the airport. The staff are excellent and very helpful and the rooms are clean and tidy and very well maintained. Added to that the complimentary breakfast was very good.I would have no hesitation in staying at The Hampton Inn again and would thoroughly recommend it as a good place close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service and location”
Reviews.Author: FishJNUAK
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful in giving directions to area attractions and shopping! The room was great and the morning breakfast was excellent! A great place for the corporate traveler and families. I look forward to another visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn & Suites Phoenix Airport South
HotelInfo.Address: 4234 South 48th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85040
